WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescASCII
WebMessage.HTML: Converts a single character string to its corresponding ASCII code, between 0 and 255.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescAbs
WebMessage.HTML: Calculates the absolute value of a numerical expression.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescAcos
WebMessage.HTML: Calculates the arc cosine of a numerical expression.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescAggregateAt
WebMessage.HTML: This function aggregates columns based on the level or levels you specify.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescAgo
WebMessage.HTML: A time series aggregation function that calculates the aggregated value from the current time back to a specified time period. For example, Ago can produce sales for every month of the current quarter and the corresponding quarter-ago sales.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescAsin
WebMessage.HTML: Calculates the arc sine of a numerical expression.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescAtan
WebMessage.HTML: Calculates the arc tangent of a numerical expression.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescAtan2
WebMessage.HTML: Calculates the arc tangent of y/x, where y is the first numerical expression and x is the second numerical expression.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescAvg
WebMessage.HTML: Calculates the average (mean) value of an expression in a result set.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescAvgDistinct
WebMessage.HTML: Calculates the average (mean) of all distinct values of an expression.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescBitLength
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the length, in bits, of a specified string. Each Unicode character is 2 bytes in length, which is equal to 16 bits.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescBottomN
WebMessage.HTML: Ranks the lowest n values of the expression argument from 1 to n, 1 corresponding to the lowest numerical value.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescCaseIf
WebMessage.HTML: This form of the Case statement evaluates each WHEN condition and if satisfied, assigns the value in the corresponding THEN expression. If none of the WHEN conditions are satisfied, it assigns the default value specified in the ELSE expression. If no ELSE expression is specified, the system will automatically add an ELSE NULL.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescCaseSwitch
WebMessage.HTML: This form of the Case statement is also referred to as the CASE (Lookup) form. The value of expression1 is examined, then the WHEN expressions. If expression1 matches any WHEN expression, it assigns the value in the corresponding THEN expression. If none of the WHEN expressions match, it assigns the default value specified in the ELSE expression. If no ELSE expression is specified, the system will automatically add an ELSE NULL.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescCast
WebMessage.HTML: Changes the data type of a value or a null value to another data type.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescCeiling
WebMessage.HTML: Rounds a noninteger numerical expression to the next highest integer.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescChar
WebMessage.HTML: Converts a numerical value between 0 and 255 to the character value corresponding to the ASCII code.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescCharLength
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the length, in number of characters, of a specified string.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescConcat
WebMessage.HTML: Concatenates two character strings.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescCos
WebMessage.HTML: Calculates the cosine of a numerical expression.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescCot
WebMessage.HTML: Calculates the cotangent of a numerical expression.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescCount
WebMessage.HTML: Calculates the number of rows having a non-null value for the expression.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescCountDistinct
WebMessage.HTML: Adds distinct processing to the Count function.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescCountRows
WebMessage.HTML: شمارش تعداد سطرها

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescCurrentDate
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the current date. The date is determined by the system in which the is running.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescCurrentTime
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the current time. The time is determined by the system in which the is running.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescCurrentTimeStamp
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the current date/timestamp. The timestamp is determined by the system in which the is running.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescDatabase
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the name of the Oracle BI subject area to which you are logged on.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescDayName
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the name of the day for a specified date.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescDayOfMonth
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the number corresponding to the day of the month for a specified date.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescDayOfQuarter
WebMessage.HTML: Returns a number (between 1 and 92) corresponding to the day of the quarter for the specified date.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescDayOfWeek
WebMessage.HTML: Returns a number between 1 and 7 corresponding to the day of the week, Sunday through Saturday, for a specified date.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescDayOfYear
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the number (between 1 and 366) corresponding to the day of the year for a specified date.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescDegrees
WebMessage.HTML: Converts an expression from radians to degrees.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescEvaluate
WebMessage.HTML: Passes the specified database function with (optional) referenced columns as parameters to the back-end data source for evaluation. This function is intended for scalar and analytic calculations, and is useful when you want to use a specialized database function that is not supported by the Oracle BI Server, but that is understood by the underlying datasource. The embedded database function may require one or more columns. These columns are referenced by %1 ... %N within the function. The actual columns must be listed after the function.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescEvaluateAggr
WebMessage.HTML: Passes the specified database function with (optional) referenced columns as parameters to the back-end data source for evaluation. This function is intended for aggregate functions with a GROUP BY clause. The embedded database function may require one or more columns. These columns are referenced by %1 ... %N within the function. The actual columns must be listed after the function.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescExp
WebMessage.HTML: Sends the value to the power specified.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescFloor
WebMessage.HTML: Rounds a noninteger numerical expression to the next lowest integer.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescHour
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the number (between 0 and 23) corresponding to the hour for a specified time.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescIfNull
WebMessage.HTML: Tests if an expression evaluates to a null value, and if it does, assigns the specified value to the expression.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescInsert
WebMessage.HTML: Inserts a specified character string into a specified location in another character string.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescLeft
WebMessage.HTML: Returns a specified number of characters from the left of a string.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescLength
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the length, in number of characters, of a specified string. The length is returned excluding any trailing blank characters.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescLocate
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the numerical position of a character string in another character string.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescLocateN
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the numerical position of a character string in another character string. This is identical to the Locate function, except that the search begins at the position specified by an integer argument.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescLog
WebMessage.HTML: Calculates the natural logarithm of an expression.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescLog10
WebMessage.HTML: Calculates the base 10 logarithm of an expression.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescLower
WebMessage.HTML: Converts a character string to lowercase.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescMAVG
WebMessage.HTML: Calculates a moving average (mean) for the last n rows of data in the result set, inclusive of the current row.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescMSUM
WebMessage.HTML: This function calculates a moving sum for the last n rows of data, inclusive of the current row.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescMavg
WebMessage.HTML: Calculates a moving average (mean) for the last n rows of data, inclusive of the current row.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescMax
WebMessage.HTML: Calculates the maximum value (highest numeric value) of the rows satisfying the numeric expression argument.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescMedian
WebMessage.HTML: Calculates the median (middle) value of the rows satisfying the numeric expression argument.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescMin
WebMessage.HTML: Calculates the minimum value (lowest numeric value) of the rows satisfying the numeric expression argument.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescMinute
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the number (between 0 and 59) corresponding to the minute for a specified time.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescMod
WebMessage.HTML: Divides the first numerical expression by the second numerical expression and returns the remainder portion of the quotient.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescMonth
WebMessage.HTML: Returns a number (between 1 and 12) corresponding to the month for a specified date.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescMonthName
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the name of the month for a specified date.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescMonthOfQuarter
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the number (between 1 and 3) corresponding to the month in the quarter for a specified date.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescNTile
WebMessage.HTML: Determines the rank of a value in terms of a user-specified range. It returns integers to represent any range of ranks. NTile with numTiles=100 returns what is commonly called the "percentile" (with numbers ranging from 1 to 100, with 100 representing the high end of the sort).

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescNow
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the current timestamp. This function is equivalent to the function Current_TimeStamp.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescOctetLength
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the number of bits, in base 8 units (number of bytes), of a specified string.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescPercentile
WebMessage.HTML: Calculates a percentile rank for each value satisfying the numeric expression argument. The percentile rank ranges are between 0 (0th percentile) to 1 (100th percentile).

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescPeriodRolling
WebMessage.HTML: This function computes the sum of a measure over the period starting x units of time and ending y units of time from the current time. The unit of time is determined by the measure level of the measures in its first argument and the query level of the query to which the function belongs. For more information, click Help.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescPi
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the constant value of pi (the circumference of a circle divided by its diameter).

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescPosition
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the numerical position of expr1 in a character expression.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescPower
WebMessage.HTML: Takes the first numerical expression and raises it to the power specified in the second numerical expression.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescQuarterOfYear
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the number (between 1 and 4) corresponding to the quarter of the year for a specified date.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescRCOUNT
WebMessage.HTML: This function takes a set of records as input and counts the number of records encountered so far.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescRMAX
WebMessage.HTML: This function takes a set of records as input and shows the maximum value based on records encountered so far.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescRMIN
WebMessage.HTML: This function takes a set of records as input and shows the minimum value based on records encountered so far.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescRSUM
WebMessage.HTML: This function calculates a running sum based on records encountered so far.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescRadians
WebMessage.HTML: Converts an expression from degrees to radians.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescRand
WebMessage.HTML: Returns a pseudo-random number between 0 and 1.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescRandFromSeed
WebMessage.HTML: Returns a pseudo-random number based on a seed value.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescRank
WebMessage.HTML: Calculates the rank for each value satisfying the numeric expression argument. The highest number is assigned a rank of 1, and each successive rank is assigned the next consecutive integer (2, 3, 4,...). If certain values are equal, they are assigned the same rank (for example, 1, 1, 1, 4, 5, 5, 7...).

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescRepeat
WebMessage.HTML: Repeats a specified expression n times.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescReplace
WebMessage.HTML: Replaces one or more characters from a specified character expression with one or more other characters.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescRight
WebMessage.HTML: Returns a specified number of characters from the right of a string.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescRound
WebMessage.HTML: Rounds a numerical expression to n digits of precision.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescSecond
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the number (between 0 and 59) corresponding to the seconds for a specified time.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescSign
WebMessage.HTML: Returns: 1 if the numerical expression argument evaluates to a positive number, -1 if it evaluates to a negative number, or 0 (zero) if it evaluates to zero.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescSin
WebMessage.HTML: Calculates the sine of a numerical expression.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescSpace
WebMessage.HTML: Inserts blank spaces.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescSqrt
WebMessage.HTML: Calculates the square root of the numerical expression argument.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescStdDev
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the standard deviation for a set of values.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescStdDevPop
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the standard deviation for a set of values using the computational formula for population variance and standard deviation.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescSubstring
WebMessage.HTML: Creates a new string starting from a fixed number of characters into the original string.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescSum
WebMessage.HTML: Calculates the sum obtained by adding up all values satisfying the numeric expression argument.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescSumDistinct
WebMessage.HTML: Calculates the sum obtained by adding all of the distinct values satisfying the numeric expression argument.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescTan
WebMessage.HTML: Calculates the tangent of a numerical expression.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescTimestampAdd
WebMessage.HTML: Adds a specified number of intervals to a specified timestamp, and returns a single timestamp.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescTimestampDiff
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the total number of specified intervals between two timestamps.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescToDate
WebMessage.HTML: A time series aggregation function that aggregates a measure attribute from the beginning of a specified time period to the current time. For example, this function can calculate Year to Date sales.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescTopN
WebMessage.HTML: Ranks the highest n values of the expression argument from 1 to n, 1 corresponding to the highest numerical value.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescTrimBoth
WebMessage.HTML: Strips specified leading and trailing characters from a character string.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescTrimLeading
WebMessage.HTML: Strips specified leading characters from a character string.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescTrimTrailing
WebMessage.HTML: Strips specified trailing characters from a character string.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescTruncate
WebMessage.HTML: Truncates a decimal number to return a specified number of places from the decimal point.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescUpper
WebMessage.HTML: Converts a character string to uppercase.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescUser
WebMessage.HTML: Returns the user name for the Oracle BI Repository to which you are logged on.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescValueOf
WebMessage.HTML: Use the VALUEOF function in a filter to reference the value of an Oracle BI repository variable.

WebMessage.HTML: Returns a number (between 1 and 13) corresponding to the week of the quarter for the specified date.

WebMessage.name: kmsgFunctionSelectorDescWeekOfYear
WebMessage.HTML: Returns a number (between 1 and 53) corresponding to the week of the year for the specified date.
